message:
This rule is part of the Kubernetes [Pod Security Standards (PSS) restricted policies](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/pod-security-standards/#restricted).   
This rule checks whether the pod is running containers with authorized additional capabilities.     
This rule fails if the `securityContext.capabilities.add` contains any capability beyond `NET_BIND_SERVICE` and if `securityContext.capabilities.drop` is not set to `ALL`.  
By default, if the `securityContext.capabilities.add` key is not set, the pod will not run with additional capabilities, and the rule will pass.   
Linux capabilities allow granting certain privileges to a container without granting any unnecessary ones intended for the root user.

rule.description:
This rule is part of the Kubernetes [Pod Security Standards (PSS) restricted policies](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/pod-security-standards/#restricted).   
This rule checks whether the pod is running containers with authorized additional capabilities.     
This rule fails if the `securityContext.capabilities.add` contains any capability beyond `NET_BIND_SERVICE` and if `securityContext.capabilities.drop` is not set to `ALL`.  
By default, if the `securityContext.capabilities.add` key is not set, the pod will not run with additional capabilities, and the rule will pass.   
Linux capabilities allow granting certain privileges to a container without granting any unnecessary ones intended for the root user.
rule.name: Pod should run containers with authorized additional capabilities (PSS Restricted)
rule.remediation:
Follow the step below to ensure that each [Pod](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods) should runs containers with allowed additional capabilities: 
* The following capabilities are not allowed : {{removeUnnecessaryCapabilities}} .  
* `securityContext.capabilities.drop` key is set to `ALL`.
